TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed Validity extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: A type that is used to specify the validity of a user ID in a key.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Libgpgme.Validity Full = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The user ID is fully valid. The string representation of this validity is "f".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Libgpgme.Validity Marginal = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The user ID is marginally valid. The string representation of this validity is "m".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Libgpgme.Validity Never = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The user ID is never valid. The string representation of this validity is "n".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Libgpgme.Validity Ultimate = int32(5)

Docs.summary: The user ID is ultimately valid. The string representation of this validity is "u".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Libgpgme.Validity Undefined = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The validity of the user ID is undefined. The string representation of this validity is "q".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Libgpgme.Validity Unknown = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The user ID is of unknown validity. The string representation of this validity is "?".
